20110106030119.000|20110106030121.000|TR0|journal.  It accused a researcher, Andrew 
20110106030121.000|20110106030123.000|TR0|Wakefield, of outright fraud.
20110106030123.000|20110106030125.000|TR0|
20110106030125.000|20110106030127.000|TR0|Now, Wakefield is not just any researcher. 
20110106030127.000|20110106030129.000|TR0| His 1998 study on autism and childhood 
20110106030129.000|20110106030131.000|TR0|vaccines literally changed the way many 
20110106030131.000|20110106030133.000|TR0|parents think about vaccines.  The study 
20110106030133.000|20110106030135.000|TR0|was based on just 12 children. That's 
20110106030135.000|20110106030137.000|TR0|right, 12 children.  But many parents 
20110106030137.000|20110106030139.000|TR0|desperate for answers around the world 
20110106030139.000|20110106030141.000|TR0|embraced Wakefield's claim that he had 
20110106030141.000|20110106030143.000|TR0|found a link between autism and the 
20110106030143.000|20110106030145.000|TR0|vaccine for measles, mumps and rubella.
20110106030145.000|20110106030147.000|TR0|

20110106030149.000|20110106030150.000|TR0|vocal autism activist whose son was

20110106030152.000|20110106030154.000|TR0|spread the message, using Wakefield's 
20110106030154.000|20110106030156.000|TR0|research as ammunition.

20110106030325.000|20110106030327.000|TR0|COOPER:  For the record, the mercury-based 
20110106030327.000|20110106030329.000|TR0|preservative he's talking about was 
20110106030329.000|20110106030331.000|TR0|removed from most childhood vaccines in 
20110106030331.000|20110106030332.000|TR0|2001, yet autism rates have continued to 
20110106030332.000|20110106030334.000|TR0|climb.
20110106030334.000|20110106030336.000|TR0|
20110106030336.000|20110106030338.000|TR0|Representative Burton made those remarks 
20110106030338.000|20110106030340.000|TR0|in 2008.  And, by then, Wakefield's study, 
20110106030340.000|20110106030342.000|TR0|which was first published in "The Lancet" 
20110106030342.000|20110106030344.000|TR0|in 1998, had come under heavy fire in the 
20110106030344.000|20110106030346.000|TR0|scientific community.  In 2004, 10 of 
20110106030346.000|20110106030348.000|TR0|Wakefield's 12 co-authors removed their 
20110106030348.000|20110106030350.000|TR0|names from the paper.
20110106030350.000|20110106030352.000|TR0|
20110106030352.000|20110106030354.000|TR0|Last year, "The Lancet" retracted the 
20110106030354.000|20110106030356.000|TR0|study, citing numerous problems with its 
20110106030356.000|20110106030358.000|TR0|methods, as well as ethical missteps and 
20110106030358.000|20110106030400.000|TR0|financial conflicts of interest.  A few 
20110106030400.000|20110106030402.000|TR0|months later, Wakefield lost his license 
20110106030402.000|20110106030404.000|TR0|to practice medicine in the U.K.  It was 
20110106030404.000|20110106030406.000|TR0|taken away from him.
20110106030406.000|20110106030408.000|TR0|
20110106030408.000|20110106030410.000|TR0|And now tonight, the medical journal "BMJ" 
20110106030410.000|20110106030412.000|TR0|is calling his study more than just bad 
20110106030412.000|20110106030414.000|TR0|science.  Its editors say it is -- quote 
20110106030414.000|20110106030416.000|TR0|-- "an elaborate fraud that has done 
20110106030416.000|20110106030418.000|TR0|long-lasting damage to the public's 
20110106030418.000|20110106030420.000|TR0|health."
20110106030420.000|20110106030422.000|TR0|
20110106030422.000|20110106030423.000|TR0|They're talking about the fact that a lot 
20110106030423.000|20110106030425.000|TR0|of parents stopped vaccinating their kids 
20110106030425.000|20110106030427.000|TR0|after Wakefield's study came out, both in 
20110106030427.000|20110106030429.000|TR0|England and in the United States.  In 
20110106030429.000|20110106030431.000|TR0|recent years, there have been measles 
20110106030431.000|20110106030433.000|TR0|outbreaks in California, Illinois, New 
20110106030433.000|20110106030435.000|TR0|York, Wisconsin.  Last year in California, 
20110106030435.000|20110106030437.000|TR0|there were more cases of whooping cough 
20110106030437.000|20110106030439.000|TR0|than in any year since 1947.  Ten children 
20110106030439.000|20110106030441.000|TR0|died, 10 infants.       But Andrew 
20110106030441.000|20110106030443.000|TR0|Wakefield hasn't lost his loyal following, 
20110106030443.000|20110106030445.000|TR0|even though his study has been debunked, 
20110106030445.000|20110106030447.000|TR0|even after he's lost his medical license. 
20110106030447.000|20110106030449.000|TR0|On the contrary, his supporters see him as 
20110106030449.000|20110106030451.000|TR0|a victim.
20110106030451.000|20110106030453.000|TR0|

20110106030455.000|20110106030457.000|TR0|McCarthy and actor Jim Carrey said -- and 
20110106030457.000|20110106030459.000|TR0|I quote -- "It is our most sincere belief

20110106030501.000|20110106030503.000|TR0|with autism around the world are being

20110106030507.000|20110106030509.000|TR0|Wakefield is being vilified through a

20110106030518.000|20110106030520.000|TR0|new trails, has been attacked by his own

20110106030542.000|20110106030544.000|TR0|been a fraud. Starting tonight, the

20110106030914.000|20110106030916.000|TR0|

20110106030918.000|20110106030920.000|TR0|attempt to crush any investigation into 
20110106030920.000|20110106030922.000|TR0|valid vaccine safety concerns, not just my 
20110106030922.000|20110106030924.000|TR0|concerns.  I'm here at a meeting of

20110106033754.000|20110106033756.000|TR0|find some way to take care of those kids,

20110106033758.000|20110106033800.000|TR0| So, even when you have a case like with 
20110106033800.000|20110106033802.000|TR0|that measles epidemic, where it's true 
20110106033802.000|20110106033804.000|TR0|that children didn't die, you had one 
20110106033804.000|20110106033806.000|TR0|infant that was hospitalized for a serious 
20110106033806.000|20110106033808.000|TR0|amount of time, and dozens of families 
20110106033808.000|20110106033810.000|TR0|that had to pay an enormous amount of 
20110106033810.000|20110106033812.000|TR0|money because of this.
20110106033812.000|20110106033814.000|TR0|
20110106033814.000|20110106033816.000|TR0|COOPER:  This is maybe an unfair and an 
20110106033816.000|20110106033818.000|TR0|impossible question to answer, is, do you 
20110106033818.000|20110106033820.000|TR0|believe Wakefield believes what he's

20110106033924.000|20110106033926.000|TR0|MNOOKIN:  I think absolutely.  And an 
20110106033926.000|20110106033928.000|TR0|example I use is there are people who 
20110106033928.000|20110106033930.000|TR0|believe the earth is flat.  Most people

20110106033940.000|20110106033942.000|TR0|was split 50/50.
20110106033942.000|20110106033944.000|TR0|

20110106033954.000|20110106033956.000|TR0|him, a miniscule number of people, saying, 
20110106033956.000|20110106033958.000|TR0|"No, this is what's actually going on."    
20110106033958.000|20110106034000.000|TR0|   But because we can't present millions 
20110106034000.000|20110106034002.000|TR0|of points of view or millions of people, 
20110106034002.000|20110106034004.000|TR0|it ends up sounding -- there's this false
